taskDescription: Products are tangible items offered for exchange between a buyer and seller. Services are intangible solutions that are also an exchange between buyer and seller. Ramblewood provides event planning. As part of its “offering,” it also supplies flowers, decor, and food. Where does the Ramblewood offering fall on the product–service continuum?
